title: Trophy Cup And Case, 1773–75
markings: Marks: Cover and cup marked with "AD" in oval and the Augsburg pine cone surmounting a "W."
inscribed: Within cartouche on front of body: "Dieser Hirsch von 24. Enden, ist von Sr des Herrn Margrafens zu Brandenburg Onolz-und Culmbach Christian Friedrich Carl Alexander Horchfürstl. Durchaucht de 21. Aug. 1771 auf Gefrenser Wildfuhr mit 4. Haz- und 1. Wind-Hund angehezet, und in dem Weyler Hardmannsreuth gefangen dieses aber von Höchst Ihro Hochfürstl Durchl zum Gnaden Zeichen, dem Wildmeister George Michael Castner verehret worden."
provenance: Grigsby (Emilie) Collection, Sale Catalogue, Anderson Galleries, January 24, 1912, No. 731 (described as follows:...An engraved inscription,dated August 21, 1771, shows that the cup was formerly in the possession of Christian F.C. Alexander, Margrave of Brandenburg. ...Maker's mark, AD, Abraham Drentwet (Master, 1741 died 1785) Augsburg...". Rosenberg 222. No 936.
dimensions:
H x diam. (a, trophy): 17 x 9.8 cm (6 11/16 x 3 7/8 in.)
H x diam. (b, trophy cup): 9 x 10.2 cm (3 9/16 x 4 in.)
H x diam. (c, trophy cup): 20 x 12 cm (7 7/8 x 4 3/4 in.)
description: Round domed cover surmounted by a full round twenty-four-point stag. Round,footed, shaped cup. Both chased with parcel gilt decorated scrolls and, on the cup, trophies of the hunt. Hinged case is red-painted wood decorated in gold and colors and lined with green silk velvet. Painted in two ivory reserves with one pastoral and one hunting scene.

tombstone.epitaph:
Trophy Cup And Case, 1773–75.
1773–75. silver (parcel gilt), wood (painted). Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1949-131-1-a/d.
